perturbation.original_text:
(i) maintain the insurance coverages and limits required by this Section and any additional insurance and/or bonds required by Laws:
1. at all times during the term of this Agreement and until completion of all Work associated with this Agreement, whichever is later; and
2. with respect to any coverage maintained in a “claims-made” policy, for two (2) years following the term of this Agreement or completion of all Work associated with this Agreement, whichever is later. If a “claims-made” policy is maintained, the retroactive date must precede the commencement of Work under this Agreement;
perturbation.changed_text: (i) maintain the insurance coverages and limits required by this Section. Vendor shall procure the required insurance from an insurance company eligible to do business in the state or states where Work will be performed
perturbation.explanation: This change removes the requirements for maintaining insurance coverage for a specified duration and ensures that any 'claims-made' policy aligns with work commencement. This violates general commercial law, where businesses have to maintain coverage long enough based on their business type. The absence of specific durations weakens compliance obligations.

perturbation.original_text:
1. include AT&T, its Affiliates, and their directors, officers, and employees as additional insureds. Vendor shall provide a copy of the additional insured endorsement to AT&T. The additional insured endorsement may either be specific to AT&T or may be “blanket” or “automatic” addressing any Person as required by contract. A copy of the additional insured endorsement must be provided within sixty (60) days of execution of this Agreement and within sixty (60) days of each Commercial General Liability policy renewal;
2. include a waiver of subrogation in favor of AT&T, its Affiliates, and their directors, officers and employees; and
3. be primary and non-contributory with respect to any insurance or self-insurance that is maintained by AT&T.
perturbation.changed_text:
1. include AT&T as additional insureds. 
2. include a waiver of subrogation.
3. be primary with respect to any insurance or self-insurance that is maintained by AT&T.
perturbation.explanation: This change omits that the 'endorsement must be provided within sixty (60) days of execution of this Agreement and within sixty (60) days of each Commercial General Liability policy renewal'. Many businesses have to provide proof or records of insurance within a specified period.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Many states have commercial insurance regulations about timelines

perturbation.original_text:
(vii) Explosion, Collapse, and Underground Damage Liability must not be excluded from the
Commercial General Liability policy for any Work involving explosives or any underground Work.
Explosion, Collapse, and Underground Damage Liability will have the same limit requirement as the
Commercial General Liability policy.
perturbation.changed_text:
(vii) Explosion, Collapse, and Underground Damage Liability may be excluded from the
Commercial General Liability policy for any Work involving explosives or any underground Work.
perturbation.explanation: This change modifies a clause requiring specific coverage (Explosion, Collapse, and Underground Damage Liability) to permit its exclusion from the Commercial General Liability policy. Many states have requirements on what types of work must have these insurances.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Commercial insurance regulations in many states
